what: Bayesian Statistical Tools for Quantitative Proteomics
title: Bayesian Statistical Tools for Quantitative Proteomics
text: Bayesian toolbox quantitative proteomics. particular, package provides functions generate synthetic datasets, execute Bayesian differential analysis methods, display results.

title: Bayesian Statistical Tools for Quantitative Proteomics
text: can install released version ProteoBayes CRAN : can install development version ProteoBayes like : want use ProteoBayes without coding single line, feel free use dedicated web app: https://arthurleroy.shinyapps.io/ProteoBayes/. keen learn R code behind, just scroll !

title: Bayesian Statistical Tools for Quantitative Proteomics
text: Generate synthetic proteomics dataset correct format: parameters posterior distributions can computed thanks : considering Peptides independently (inter-Peptides correlations), method unaffected missing values imputation necessary. can also consider correlations Peptides using multivariate version method. context, missing values need imputed beforehand (multiple imputations accepted), dedicated function : parameters posterior distributions available. can sample distributions visualise differences groups peptide using:  comparing large number Peptides simultaneously, function identify_diff() can used check probable differences groups Peptide:
code: library(ProteoBayes) set.seed(42)  ## Generate a dataset without imputations data = simu_db()  ## Generate a dataset with multiple imputations data_imp = simu_db(multi_imp = TRUE)  data #> # A tibble: 50 x 4 #>    Peptide   Group Sample Output #>    <chr>     <int>  <int>  <dbl> #>  1 Peptide_1     1      1   48.8 #>  2 Peptide_1     1      2   46.5 #>  3 Peptide_1     1      3   49.8 #>  4 Peptide_1     1      4   49.9 #>  5 Peptide_1     1      5   47.4 #>  6 Peptide_1     2      1   54.9 #>  7 Peptide_1     2      2   49.4 #>  8 Peptide_1     2      3   52.0 #>  9 Peptide_1     2      4   49.6 #> 10 Peptide_1     2      5   55.0 #> # i 40 more rows data_imp #> # A tibble: 250 x 5 #>    Peptide   Group Sample Output  Draw #>    <chr>     <int>  <int>  <dbl> <int> #>  1 Peptide_1     1      1   51.8     1 #>  2 Peptide_1     1      1   51.3     2 #>  3 Peptide_1     1      1   51.6     3 #>  4 Peptide_1     1      1   51.9     4 #>  5 Peptide_1     1      1   51.8     5 #>  6 Peptide_1     1      2   52.5     1 #>  7 Peptide_1     1      2   52.6     2 #>  8 Peptide_1     1      2   52.0     3 #>  9 Peptide_1     1      2   52.0     4 #> 10 Peptide_1     1      2   50.8     5 #> # i 240 more rows post = posterior_mean(data)  post #> # A tibble: 10 x 6 #>    Peptide   Group    mu lambda alpha  beta #>    <chr>     <int> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 Peptide_1     1  48.8      6   3.5  6.81 #>  2 Peptide_1     2  51.9      6   3.5 17.2  #>  3 Peptide_2     1  51.5      6   3.5  3.54 #>  4 Peptide_2     2  53.5      6   3.5 10.6  #>  5 Peptide_3     1  18.6      6   3.5  6.61 #>  6 Peptide_3     2  20.9      6   3.5 11.8  #>  7 Peptide_4     1  44.0      6   3.5  7.00 #>  8 Peptide_4     2  46.0      6   3.5 17.8  #>  9 Peptide_5     1  34.0      6   3.5 30.7  #> 10 Peptide_5     2  37.7      6   3.5  5.40 post_imp = multi_posterior_mean(data_imp)  post_imp #> # A tibble: 250 x 8 #>     Draw Group Peptide   Peptide2     mu lambda    nu  Sigma #>    <int> <int> <chr>     <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> #>  1     1     1 Peptide_1 Peptide_1  50.4      6    15 57.4   #>  2     1     1 Peptide_1 Peptide_2  50.4      6    15 -1.25  #>  3     1     1 Peptide_1 Peptide_3  50.4      6    15 11.5   #>  4     1     1 Peptide_1 Peptide_4  50.4      6    15 -8.05  #>  5     1     1 Peptide_1 Peptide_5  50.4      6    15 -3.92  #>  6     1     1 Peptide_2 Peptide_1  41.7      6    15 -1.25  #>  7     1     1 Peptide_2 Peptide_2  41.7      6    15  6.08  #>  8     1     1 Peptide_2 Peptide_3  41.7      6    15  2.85  #>  9     1     1 Peptide_2 Peptide_4  41.7      6    15 -0.206 #> 10     1     1 Peptide_2 Peptide_5  41.7      6    15 -2.40  #> # i 240 more rows sample = sample_distrib(post)  plot_distrib(sample, group1 = 1, group2 = 2, peptide = 'Peptide_1' ) identify_diff(post) #> # A tibble: 10 x 10 #>    Peptide   Group    mu CI_inf CI_sup Group2   mu2 CI_inf2 CI_sup2 Distinct #>    <chr>     <int> <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <int> <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <lgl>    #>  1 Peptide_1     1  48.8   47.5   50.2      2  51.9    49.7    54.0 FALSE    #>  2 Peptide_1     2  51.9   49.7   54.0      1  48.8    47.5    50.2 FALSE    #>  3 Peptide_2     1  51.5   50.6   52.5      2  53.5    51.9    55.2 FALSE    #>  4 Peptide_2     2  53.5   51.9   55.2      1  51.5    50.6    52.5 FALSE    #>  5 Peptide_3     1  18.6   17.3   20.0      2  20.9    19.1    22.7 FALSE    #>  6 Peptide_3     2  20.9   19.1   22.7      1  18.6    17.3    20.0 FALSE    #>  7 Peptide_4     1  44.0   42.6   45.4      2  46.0    43.8    48.2 FALSE    #>  8 Peptide_4     2  46.0   43.8   48.2      1  44.0    42.6    45.4 FALSE    #>  9 Peptide_5     1  34.0   31.1   36.8      2  37.7    36.5    38.9 FALSE    #> 10 Peptide_5     2  37.7   36.5   38.9      1  34.0    31.1    36.8 FALSE

title: Identify posterior mean differences — identify_diff
text: Compute criterion based Credible Intervals (CI) determine whether posterior t-distributions groups considered different enough deserve examination. Two groups considered probably 'distinct' Credible Interval level CI_level respective posterior t-distributions overlap.

title: Identify posterior mean differences — identify_diff
Identify posterior mean differences — identify_diff
text: posterior tibble, typically coming posterior_mean() function, containing parameters multivariate posterior t-distributions mean considered groups draws peptide. CI_level number, defining order quantile chosen assess differences groups. nb_sample number (optional), indicating number samples draw posteriors computing mean credible intervals . used posterior multivariate, typically coming multi_posterior_mean() function.

title: Identify posterior mean differences — identify_diff
text: tibble, indicating peptides groups seem different

title: Identify posterior mean differences — identify_diff

what: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff
title: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff
text: Compute multivariate inference criterion examine whether posterior multivariate t-distributions groups considered different enough called 'differential'. Two groups considered can discriminated based probability weights element-wise means greater group. Credible Intervals marginals also provided.

title: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff
code: multi_identify_diff(   posterior,   plot = TRUE,   cumulative = FALSE,   CI_level = 0.05,   nb_sample = 10000,   nb_sample_per_dim = NULL )

title: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff
text: posterior tibble, typically coming posterior_mean() function, containing parameters multivariate posterior t-distributions mean considered groups draws peptide. plot boolean, indicating whether results plot displayed. cumulative boolean, indicating whether probability distribution cumulative instead. CI_level number, defining order quantile chosen assess differences groups. nb_sample number samples draw empirical distributions nb_sample_per_dim

title: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff
text: tibble, indicating probability distribution number differentiable peptides one--one group comparisons

title: Identify differences in multivariate posteriors — multi_identify_diff

what: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean
title: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean
text: Compute multivariate posterior distribution means multiple groups, multiple correlated peptides. function accounts multiple imputations Draw identifier dataset.

title: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean
code: multi_posterior_mean(   data,   mu_0 = NULL,   lambda_0 = 1,   Sigma_0 = NULL,   nu_0 = 10,   vectorised = FALSE )

title: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean
text: data tibble data frame containing imputed data sets groups. Required columns: Peptide, Group, Sample, Output. missing data estimated multiple imputations, imputation identified optional Draw column. mu_0 vector, corresponding prior mean. NULL, groups initialised empirical mean peptide. lambda_0 number, corresponding prior covariance scaling parameter. Sigma_0 matrix, corresponding prior covariance parameter. NULL, identity matrix used default. nu_0 number, corresponding prior degrees freedom. vectorised boolean, indicating whether used vectorised version function. Default nb_peptides < 30. nb_peptides > 30, high risk vectorised version slower.

title: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean
text: tibble providing parameters multivariate posterior t-distribution mean considered groups draws peptide.

title: Multivariate posterior distribution of the means — multi_posterior_mean

what: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib
title: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib
text: Display posterior distribution difference means two groups specific peptide. one group provide, function display posterior distribution mean specific group instead. function provides additional tools represent information help inference regarding difference groups (reference 0 x-axis, probability group1 > group2 conversely).

title: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib
code: plot_distrib(   sample_distrib,   group1 = NULL,   group2 = NULL,   peptide = NULL,   prob_CI = 0.95,   show_prob = TRUE,   mean_bar = TRUE,   index_group1 = NULL,   index_group2 = NULL )

title: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib
text: sample_distrib data frame, typically coming sample_distrib() function, containing following columns: Peptide, Group Sample. argument contain empirical posterior distributions displayed. group1 character string, corresponding name group plot posterior distribution mean. NULL (default), first group appearing sample_distrib displayed. group2 provided, posterior difference groups displayed instead. group2 character string, corresponding name group want compare group1. NULL (default), posterior distribution mean group1 displayed. peptide character string, corresponding name peptide plot posterior distribution mean. NULL (default), first appearing sample_distrib displayed. prob_CI number, 0 1, corresponding level Credible Interval (CI), represented side regions (red) posterior distribution. default value (0.95) display 95% CI, meaning central region (blue) contains 95% probability distribution mean. show_prob boolean, indicating whether display label probability comparisons two groups. mean_bar boolean, indicating whether display vertical bar corresponding 0 x-axis (comparing two groups), mean value distribution (displaying unique group). index_group1 character string, used index group1 legends. NULL (default), group1 used. index_group2 character string, used index group2 legends. NULL (default), group2 used.

title: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib
text: Plot required posterior distribution.

title: Plot the posterior distribution of the difference of means — plot_distrib

title: Plot multivariate comparison between groups — plot_multi_diff
text: Graphical representation inference multivariate difference analysis context. plotted empirical distribution represents, one--one group comparison, probability number elements mean peptide larger given group. provides visual evidence whether two groups differential , adequate uncertainty quantification.

Plot multivariate comparison between groups — plot_multi_diff

title: Plot multivariate comparison between groups — plot_multi_diff
text: graph (matrix graphs) displaying multivariate differential inference summary groups

Sample from a t-distribution — sample_distrib
text: Sample (possibly multivariate) t-distribution. function can used sample prior posterior, depending value parameters provided.

title: Sample from a t-distribution — sample_distrib
Sample from a t-distribution — sample_distrib
text: posterior tibble data frame, detailing Peptide Group, value t-distribution parameters. expected format typically return posterior_mean() function. Expected columns univariate case: mu, lambda, alpha, beta. Expected columns multivariate case: mu, lambda, Sigma, nu. nb_sample number, indicating number samples generated couple Peptide-Group.

title: Sample from a t-distribution — sample_distrib
text: tibble containing Peptide, Group Sample columns. samples Peptide-Group couple provide empirical t-distribution can used compute display differences groups.

what: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
title: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
text: Simulate complete training dataset, may representative various applications. Several flexible arguments allow adjustment number peptides, groups, samples experiment. values several parameters controlling data generation process can modified.

title: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
code: simu_db(   nb_peptide = 5,   nb_group = 2,   nb_sample = 5,   multi_imp = FALSE,   nb_draw = 5,   range_peptide = c(0, 50),   diff_group = 3,   var_sample = 2,   var_draw = 1 )

title: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
text: nb_peptide integer, indicating number peptides data. nb_group integer, indicating number groups/conditions. nb_sample integer, indicating number samples data peptide (.e repetitions experiment). multi_imp boolean, indicating whether multiple imputations applied obtain dataset. nb_draw number, indicating number imputation procedures applied obtain dataset. range_peptide 2-sized vector, indicating range values pick mean value peptide. diff_group number, indicating mean difference consecutive groups var_sample number, indicating noise variance new sample peptide. var_draw number, indicating noise variance imputation draw.

title: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
text: full dataset synthetic data.

title: Generate a synthetic dataset tailored for ProteoBayes — simu_db
code: ## Generate a dataset with 5 peptides in each of the 2 groups, observed for ##  3 different samples data = simu_db(nb_peptide = 5, nb_group = 2, nb_sample = 3)  ## Generate a dataset with 3 peptides in each of the 3 groups, observed for ## 4 different samples, for which 5 imputation draws are available. data = simu_db(nb_peptide = 3, nb_group = 3, nb_sample = 4, nb_draw = 5)

title: Vectorised version of multi_posterior_mean() — vectorised_multi

code: vectorised_multi(data, mu_0 = NULL, lambda_0 = 1, Sigma_0 = NULL, nu_0 = 10)

NULL, groups initialised empirical mean peptide. lambda_0 number, corresponding prior covariance scaling parameter. Sigma_0 matrix, corresponding prior covariance parameter. NULL, identity matrix used default. nu_0 number, corresponding prior degrees freedom.

title: Vectorised version of multi_posterior_mean() — vectorised_multi
text: tibble providing parameters posterior t-distribution mean considered groups peptide.
